intro: Draba sakuraii, commonly known as the Sakurai's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and western Japan. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. Draba sakuraii is an annual or biennial herb with basal leaves and a flowering stem that bears clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It plays a role in the alpine ecosystems where it contributes to biodiversity and soil stabilization.
